column4: anyone know the terminal command to install wxcam? and must anything need to be installed beforehand?

apt-cache search <string> to look for the package you want (replacing string with the name of the pkg your looking for), sudo apt-get install <pkg>  to install the package. apt-get should handle any dependencies for you.
you download the iso then put it on a standard 700meg blank cd- and use imgburn to mount the iso
they purposely make ubuntu versions to fit on a 700meg disc ;P
but its close i can understand -
by saying apt-get should handle any dependencies for you that means when i type sudo apt-get install <pkg> everything it needed would be downloaded and installed correct?
and that would generally imply for anything i dl?
so i wouldnt have to type update or whatever that command is first then install ?
its good to type update to have an update to date package list, or also if you specifically added or modified a repo
solarisBoy: when i used your command apt cache search<pkg> what do you get when you have like 5 or 6 results? ranging from a tool to a tracker to dev gtk-dev etc
your basically searching for a string, so the more accurate the string is the more accurate the results will be
also there are description fields in the output
